item.title: Kunstmuseum Basel | Exhibitions | Upcoming | Enthralling Engraving
item.description:
Kunstmuseum Basel | Exhibitions | Upcoming | Enthralling Engraving

The Kunstmuseum Basel's Kupferstichkabinett owns an exceptionally rich assortment of engravings by Goltzius; the exhibition will be the first to present the full breadth of our holdings. The works have been among the museum's treasures for a long time, and some can be traced to the generous donation made by the Basel landscape painter and collector Samuel Birmann (1793-1847).

item.title: Donald Judd, 'Untitled', 1969, Kunstmuseum Basel | Artsy
item.description:
Donald Judd, 'Untitled', 1969, Kunstmuseum Basel | Artsy

Donald Judd, widely regarded as one of the most significant American artists of the post-war period, is perhaps best-known for the large-scale outdoor installations and long, spacious interiors he designed in Marfa, Texas. His oeuvre has come to define what has been referred to as Minimalist art-a label the artist strongly objected to.

item.title: Ellsworth Kelly, 'Blue Red Rocker', 1963, Kunstmuseum Basel | Artsy
item.description:
Ellsworth Kelly, 'Blue Red Rocker', 1963, Kunstmuseum Basel | Artsy

Since the beginning of his career, Ellsworth Kelly's emphasis on pure form and color and his impulse to suppress gesture in favor of creating spatial unity have played a pivotal role in the development of abstract art in America.

item.title: Max Bill, 'Unendliche Schleife', 1960, Kunstmuseum Basel | Artsy
item.description:
Max Bill, 'Unendliche Schleife', 1960, Kunstmuseum Basel | Artsy

Max Bill was a hugely influential founder of the Concrete Art movement, not only through his variegated career as a sculptor, painter, and industrial and graphic designer, but also as a prolific writer, scholar, and teacher. Bill had early ambitions to be a silversmith, but quickly changed his focus to architecture after seeing the work of Le Corbusier.

item.title: Jeff Koons, 'Rabbit', 1986, Kunstmuseum Basel | Artsy
item.description:
Jeff Koons, 'Rabbit', 1986, Kunstmuseum Basel | Artsy

Jeff Koons plays with ideas of taste, pleasure, celebrity, and commerce. "I believe in advertisement and media completely," he says. "My art and my personal life are based in it."

item.title: Tessiner Landschaft - Werke - Hermann Hesse - Malerfreude - Ausstellungen - Galerie Ludorff
item.description:
Tessiner Landschaft - Werke - Hermann Hesse - Malerfreude - Ausstellungen - Galerie Ludorff

Galerie Ludorff is one of the leading international dealers in German Expressionism, German Impressionism, as well as in Post War Abstraction and the work of Selected Contemporary Artists. The gallery is located in Duesseldorf, Germany.

item.title: Alexander Calder, ' Five Branches with 1000 Leaves', ca. 1946, Kunstmuseum Basel | Artsy
item.description:
Alexander Calder, ' Five Branches with 1000 Leaves', ca. 1946, Kunstmuseum Basel | Artsy

American artist Alexander Calder changed the course of modern art by developing an innovative method of sculpting, bending, and twisting wire to create three-dimensional "drawings in space."
